meanings.definition: The act of marking with lines.
meanings.sent1: The artist's lineations on the canvas were precise and straight.
meanings.sent2: The lineations on the road helped guide the drivers safely.
meanings.sent3: The lineations on the map made it look like a giant connect-the-dots puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her lineations in the sand resembled a secret code only she could decipher.
meanings.sent5: The lineations etched into the stone monument told a story of ancient times.

meanings.sent1: The lineations of the tiles on the floor created a neat design.
meanings.sent2: The lineations of the books on the shelf were organized by color.
meanings.sent3: The lineations of the clouds in the sky looked like a giant zipper.
meanings.sent4: The lineations of the stars in the night sky formed a celestial map.
meanings.sent5: The lineations of the leaves on the tree made a beautiful pattern against the sky.

meanings.sent1: The lineations of her face showed a strong jawline.
meanings.sent2: The lineations of the landscape revealed a river running through it.
meanings.sent3: The lineations of the music notes danced across the page.
meanings.sent4: The lineations of the city skyline stood out against the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The lineations of the building's architecture gave it a modern look.
